IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO MAINTAIN AND PROMOTE CIVIL LIBERTIES AND CIVIL RIGHTS THROUGHOUT THE USA AND PARTICULARLY WITHIN THE STATE OF CT, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE FREEDOMS OF SPEECH, PRESS, ASSOCIATION AND RELIGION; THE RIGHTS TO DUE PROCESS OF LAW AND TO EQUAL PROTECTION OF LAW.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO MAINTAIN AND PROMOTE CIVIL LIBERTIES AND CIVIL RIGHTS THROUGHOUT THE USA AND PARTICULARLY WITHIN THE STATE OF CT, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE FREEDOMS OF SPEECH, PRESS, ASSOCIATION AND RELIGION; THE RIGHTS TO DUE PROCESS OF LAW AND TO EQUAL PROTECTION OF LAW.
IRS990.Desc: TO PROVIDE LEGAL SERVICES FOR CIVIL LIBERTIES AND CIVIL RIGHTS MATTERS TO BENEFIT THE GENERAL PUBLIC. TO EDUCATE, WITH RESPECT TO A WIDE RANGE OF CIVIL LIBERTIES ISSUES AND CONCERNS THROUGH LECTURES, NEWSLETTERS, ESSAYS, TREATISES, PUBLICATIONS AND SPONSORSHIPS OF PROGRAMS IN COLLEGES AND SCHOOLS. TO ADVOCATE THE PROTECTION OF CIVIL LIBERTIES AND CIVIL RIGHTS IN THE USA AND IN CT.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE , EXPLANATION FOR OTHER INCOME

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FIREHOSE FUND IS TO BE USED ON AN EMERGENCY BASIS TO ENABLE THE FOUNDATION TO CONTINUE TO MEETS ITS CURRENT PROGRAM COMMITMENTS IN THE FACE OF A SERIOUS DECLINE IN ITS EXPECETED REVENUES AND FINANCIAL RESOURCES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD MEMBERS AND OFFICERS OF THE ORGANIZATION ARE THE SAME AS THE AMERICAN CIVIL LIBERTIES UNION OF CONNECTICUT, INC. PER THE BY-LAWS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCE COMMITTEE AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR REVIEW FORM 990 IN DETAIL PRIOR TO FILING AND A COMPLETE COPY IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD AFTER THE FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION REQUIRES THAT ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD READ, UNDERSTAND AND SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT EACH YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: 15A- COMPENSATION PROCESS FOR TOP OFFICIAL: THE BOARD REVIEWS AND APPROVES COMPENSATION THROUGH THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE RECOMMENDATIONS. 15B-COMPENSATION PROCESS FOR KEY OFFICIAL: THE BOARD REVIEWS AND APPROVES COMPENSATION THROUGH THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE RECOMMENDATIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE FILED WITH THE STATE OF CONNECTICUT AND ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NAME, ADDRESS, AND EIN OF RELATED ORGANIZATION: AMERICAN CIVIL LIBERTIES UNION OF CONNECTICUT, INC. (ACLU-CT) EIN:45-2867664 765 ASYLUM AVENUE HARTFORD, CT 06105 SCHEDULE R, PART II - AMERICAN CIVIL LIBERTIES UNION OF CONNECTICUT, INC. THE AMERICAN CIVIL LIBERTIES UNION OF CONNECTICUT, INC. IS RELATED BY A COMMON BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND OFFICERS. THE ORGANIZATIONS SHARE OFFICE SPACE, EMPLOYEES AND RELATED EXPENSES.
